output_list.criticism: The mintToken function has an integer overflow that allows the owner to set the balance of any arbitrary user to any value.
The CCindexToken function allows the owner to freeze the account of any user, which gives unauthorized access to the owner.
The setPrices function uses random-seed, which can be a potential source of vulnerability. Allowing the attacker to set the balance of any user.
The buy function has an integer overflow that allows the owner to set the balance of the contract to zero, which can be a potential source of vulnerability.
The sell function has an integer overflow that allows the owner to set the balance of the contract to zero, which can be a potential source of vulnerability.
